text: Cuiba is a Guahiban language spoken in Colombia and Venezuela. There are 2,300 people who speak it in Colombia and 650 in Venezuela.Lewis, M. Paul, Gary F. Simons, and Charles D. Fennig (eds.). 2016. Ethnologue: Languages of the World, Nineteenth edition. Dallas, Texas: SIL International. Online version: http://www.ethnologue.com/language/cui, access date 23 February 2016 More than half of Cuiba speakers do not speak any other language. In Colombia the literacy rate among Cuiba speakers is 45%. ==References== Category:Languages of South America Category:Venezuela
title: Cuiba language
